channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Administration Pulls Back From Local Police Oversight Across U.S.
item.description: The Justice Department said that it would abandon efforts to overhaul local policing in Minneapolis and other cities with histories of civil rights vi...

item.title: The pace of innovation in tech has accelerated from years to months thanks to AI, Microsoft chief privacy officer says
item.description: "Now the pace of innovation has just accelerated. What used to take years to get out now takes months," Julie Brill said.

item.title: Chris Brown is out on bail after allegedly assaulting a music producer during his last tour. His next world tour starts next month
item.description: A prosecutor said Brown punched, kicked, and struck Abe Diaw several times with a bottle. The attack was caught on camera in a club full of people.

item.title: Why Washington’s Huge Tax Bill Is Worrying Bond Investors
item.description: Tax cuts pushed by President Trump are amplifying debt and deficit concerns among the powerful market players who influence interest rates.

item.title: ‘Self-deporting’ immigrants are pulling their kids out of school to flee the U.S. Experts say it spells trouble for schools that depend on student enrollments for funding
item.description: "Every student that walks in the door gets a chunk of money with it, not just federal money, but state and local money, too."

item.title: School Bus Bombing in Pakistan Kills at Least 6, Including 4 Students
item.description: The vehicle was carrying dozens of children to a military-run school in southwestern Balochistan Province, a region long roiled by rebel activity.

item.title: What to Know About Israel’s Renewed Ground Offensive in Gaza
item.description: The announcement of an escalation in the war came after a particularly deadly week for Palestinians in Gaza. Some of Israel’s allies denounced the mov...

item.title: Gerry Connolly is dead at 75. He was one of the leading voices calling for a full investigation of Elon Musk and DOGE
item.description: The late House Oversight Committee ranking member also demanded the Trump administration turn over documents about Musk’s potential conflicts of inter...

item.title: European Parliament VP discovered there was nowhere in the building to change a diaper—it took the length of her pregnancy to change that
item.description: Silvana Koch-Merin said "glass walls" exist in parliament that stop women working in more technical roles.

item.title: What if Making Cartoons Becomes 90% Cheaper?
item.description: A.I. has yet to upend Hollywood. But it is starting to make big inroads in animation.

item.title: Chris Brown Released on $6 Million Bail by London Court
item.description: The R&B singer was charged last week with grievous bodily harm over a 2023 incident in England. His release from custody means he can proceed with a w...

item.title: School Bus Bombing in Pakistan Kills at Least 6, Including 4 Students
item.description: The vehicle was carrying dozens of children to a military-run school in southwestern Balochistan Province, a region long roiled by rebel activity.

item.title: Putin Visits Kursk for First Time Since Russia Drove Out Ukrainian Forces
item.description: The Russian leader traveled to the region in the west of the country where a surprise incursion last year embarrassed Moscow.

item.title: French Government and Nestlé Accused of Cover-Up in Perrier Water Scandal
item.description: An inquiry found that Nestlé and French officials had concealed the company’s practice of filtering Perrier water it labels “natural.” The head of Nes...

item.title: Hong Kong Journalists Say Their Taxes Are Now Under Scrutiny
item.description: Several news outlets have been unreasonably subjected to tax investigations, according to the city’s journalists’ association, adding to pressures on ...
